alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Charlton; Western Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 26 at 2:46PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Charlton County through 330 PM EDT... At 245 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Homeland, moving along US 1 towards Folkston, as the storm is moving east to southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Folkston and Homeland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
